meaning: A meeting often secret, between lovers.
Morning coffee, gossip and chat with neighbors after housewives have sent their children to school.
The amount of water that can be scooped up in a hand.
A distance that allows you to listen to another conversation.
A number that doesn't vary if the numbers are inverted.
Having a sweet and gentle voice.
A feeling of bliss and the sense of oneness with the universe that comes from the simplest of pleasures.
Literally “work happiness”; the feeling of happiness provoked by a satisfying job.
A quality of cosiness and comfortable conviviality that engenders a feeling of contentment.
Inviting a lover into your bed for some pillow talk.
That feeling of excitement you get even before an event actually takes place.
Someone with deep sensitivity to the beauty of art or nature.
Nostalgia for a time that you have never lived.
Being infatuated or obsessed with another person, typically experienced involuntarily and characterized by a strong desire for reciprocation.
The subtle but persistent feeling of being out of place.
Feeling nervous or anxious in your own skin.
Work fun, finding the simple joys in everyday tasks.
Used to describe people who are at the centre of a conversation/situation/problem but can’t be found anywhere.
To not take a lungful of a cigarette.
Let off steam to release or get rid of excess energy.
Nostalgia that you feel when you are far from home.
To keep eating past the point of being full since the food tastes so good.
A face in need of a slap.
End of the work day.
Excessive eating because of frustration.
Jungle of traffic signs; a street so crowded with signs that you become lost.
A chronically unlucky person.
Items of little value; empty words that people may utter.
Inspiring or leading to the creation of schools of thought.
Thoughts and feelings about all facets of life that are unfinished or imperfect, paired with a yearning for ideal alternative experiences.
The joyful, intense anticipation that comes from imagining future pleasures.
A person who leaves a restaurant without paying.
The “spirit of the time” is what's going on culturally, religiously, or intellectually during a certain period.
Lack of concern over your spiritual life or “mental sloth”.
Selfless love to all, universal loving kindness.
Both valour and courage, expressed in actions in front of the face of danger.
The contented happy state you feel when you travel.
Something that helps you forget grief or suffering.
The inner impulse to act well and in alignment with the moral virtues that represent one's own society and upbringing.
The forgetfulness felt immediately after being given directions.
Literally “shame on time”; referring to an amazing experience that you don't want to end.
Someone too naive to see the truth in things, also used in a derogatory way.
Extorting payment from someone by sitting at their front door and staying there until you get paid.
Translated as “Donald ducking” or wandering around one’s house with a shirt but no trousers.
"""Window Weather"" i.e. weather that is nice to look at through a window but not nice to be out in."
Not being ready to spend time or money on a specific thing, despite being able to afford it.
Someone that has a novel idea that only makes things worse.
A gap between the upper front teeth.
The feeling of falling asleep after lunch or dinner.
Someone who’s preoccupation is to make appearances at social events; the tendency to be present at every social event in order to get noticed.
The bad feeling one gets after a terrible haircut.
Pretending to be out when someone knocks at your door.
To repair with gold. Understanding that a piece is more beautiful for having broken.
To eat yourself into backruptcy.
The bittersweetness of a brief and grading moment of transcendent beauty.
A woman so dedicated to her career that she has no time to iron blouses, so dresses only in knitted tops.
To brag about or sing the praises of the person you love.
Old school cool.
Acquiring reading materials but letting them pile up in one's home without reading them.
To drift between sleep and wakefulness.
Finding beauty within the imperfections of life and peacefully accepting the natural cycle of growth and decay.
An item left behind on a train or forgotten at home.
A word without meaning, said when flopping into a chair after a hard day at work or lifting a heavy bag.
The truth we all know but agree not to talk about.
Used when someone asks a question despite knowing the answer, expecting the listener to make a smart and studied guess.
Literally means stuffy; the feeling of needing to get something off your chest. Or when you want to say something but can't, or an awkward situation where people aren't saying what they mean.
To walk on tiptoes across a hot surface.
The transition from summer to fall, used to describe all the processes during the change of the seasons, for example leaves changing the colour, constant rain, etc.
The time needed to eat a banana.
To take a day (or more) off from work (e.g., because one has previously worked overtime and has built up credit).
Messy hair, in particular in the back of the head, resulting from being rubbed against the pillow during sex.
“Free air life,” signifying a fundamental understanding of the positive impact of being in nature.
Literally means sun wall; to find a sunny spot during winter time where you can sit down and enjoy the warmth of the sun.
A sympathetic word to be used when someone else is in pain. It combines “Ouch for you” and “Oh, I’m sorry you hurt yourself”.
The act of sitting outside on a sunny day enjoying a beer.
A slight inflammation of the throat caused by screaming too much.
Looking beautiful after having a disease.
Tenderly running your fingers through your lover's hair.
An informal word that means the act of figuring out things.
Doing something without planning, without putting in much effort, yet counting on success.
At its deepest and most painful, it is a sensation of great spiritual anguish, often without any specific cause.
An imaginary, horrible place where you send all those who annoy you.
To wake up in the middle of the night. Be unable to fall asleep.
Someone that is very sensitive to cold. That friend that always feel cold.
To stay up until the wee hours of the morning.
After-dinner conversation.
Drinking coffee along with eating something sweet.
The little coughing noise one makes, often before giving a speech or dislodging a piece of cinnamon bun from their throat.
Can mean “cosying up” or “to snuggle”, but in braoder sense, it means to “have a nice and relaxed time”.
Is it going down? (In the context of an elevator).
The urge to pinch or squeeze something that is unbearably cute.
Good looking from a distance.
Gettiing tired of a certain food.
Determination to chastity, even in the face of adversity.
The feeling of not wanting to impose.
To sleep on the floor without a carpet, drunk and naked.
To sense something before it actually happens.
A word made for walking in the woods at night, it’s the phantom sensation of something crawling on your skin.
A person of integrity and honour.
A witty comeback you think of only when it’s too late to use.
